page.title: 07Cultural Life in Bedlington
page.content: Although Bedlington does not have a book shop, it holds an annual Book Fayre, which is organised by Mid-Northumberland Arts Group and our library. Sinces its conception in l983, the Fayre has increased in size and scope. This year it lasted a week, attracted 2,000 people and provided a wide variety of cultural events* these included a potter display: recitations by Carol Wensby Scott, a local author, a concert by Johnny Handel, a local musician: a magic lantern show; various book displays. The Fayre has attracted many celebrities from the world of literature, theatre and television. The annual (Bedlington Miner's Picnic) provide the community with a focus for political debate and family fun. There has been no picnic this year due to lack of funds.
